clinical_study.brief_title: Switching to Rosuvastatin Versus Adding Ezetimibe to Atorvastatin Versus Doubling the Dose of Atorvastatin in Patients With Hypercholesterolemia and Risk Factors (P03708)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Multicenter Study to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of "Switching" to Rosuvastatin 10 mg Daily Versus Atorvastatin 10 mg Daily With Ezetimibe 10 mg Daily Versus Doubling the Dose of Atorvastatin to 20 mg Daily in Subjects With Hypercholesterolemia and Atherosclerotic or Coronary Vascular Disease or Diabetes Mellitus Who Have Not Achieved Study Target LDL-C Goal While Dosing With Atorvastatin 10 mg Daily

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses whether adding ezetimibe 10 mg/d to ongoing treatment with atorvastatin 10 mg/d is more effective than switching the subject to treatment with rosuvastatin 10 mg/d or doubling the dose of atorvastatin to 20 mg/d is more effective in achieving goal LDL-cholesterol of <2.5 mmol/L. Treatment phase is 6 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent change in LDL-C level from baseline to the study endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent changes from baseline to the end of treatment in the concentrations of total cholesterol (TC), non-HDL-C, apo B, triglycerides (TG), HDL-C, LDL-C/HDL-C ratio, and TC/HDL-C ratio.
Adverse events, laboratory test results, vital signs.

intervention.description: oral tablets: rosuvastatin 10 mg once daily for 6 weeks (switch from previous run-in with atorvastatin 10 mg daily)
oral tablets: ezetimibe 10 mg plus atorvastatin 10 mg once daily for 6 weeks (add ezetimibe to previous run-in with atorvastatin 10 mg daily)
oral tablets: atorvastatin 20 mg once daily for 6 weeks (double dose from previous run-in with atorvastatin 10 mg daily)
